alert.note: Alert for Clark; Scotland (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 3:10AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Hancock, Van Buren, eastern Keokuk, Washington, southwestern Muscatine, Jefferson, Henry, western Des Moines, western Louisa, Johnson, southeastern Iowa, Lee, eastern Scotland and Clark Counties through 345 AM CDT... At 310 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near South English to near Maharishi Vedic City to near Shelbyville. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Richland, South English, Harper, Pleasant Plain and Kinross around 315 AM CDT. Wellman, Brighton and Coppock around 320 AM CDT. Washington around 330 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Oxford, Ainsworth, Coralville, Tiffin, University Heights, Oakdale, Iowa City, North Liberty, Solon, Lone Tree, Riverside and Lake Macbride State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Iowa between mile markers 229 and 253. Interstate 380 between mile markers 1 and 7. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for southeastern and east central Iowa.
